title: Feeding needs a harsher punishment whether it be intentional or not
body: Hi, I've been playing league for almost 3 years now and I think I have enough experience to make this argument. The league community is referred to as toxic and most of this toxicity comes from the irritation of players who work their asses off to climb the ranked ladder. We can all agree the main trigger for toxicity in league nowadays is players feeding whether it be intentional or not. Feeding is a SERIOUS problem on league, I understand feeding is part of the game but when one good player can't necessarily carry a team but one bad player can lose the game for everyone, I think there is an issue. You can't really blame someone for going on 10 loss streak only to encounter another player that goes 5/14 on Jhin and expect them not to be irate. I feel as if these types of players need to be cut some slack because its mere frustration and sure you can say "take a break from the game" but what happens when one leaves the game and comes back to the same base of feeding players? {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

replies.body:
Intentional, sure.

Unintentional? No, that would lead to dwindling the playerbase to the point where a game couldn't even be made anymore.

Well, i'm sure we should not permaban bad players, but forcing them to win 1-2 intermediate bot or normal game would not be a huge punishment after you played like trash.

It would also reduce the tilting since bot games are very chill. And also, if you are inting, but since the system is impossibly lenient, forcing you to win 2 bot games after you inted, would reduce the number of inted games. 

I mean, yea, it's stupid to permanently ban anybody who is just bad at the game or has a bad day (well, we ban for flaming..), but letting all the soft inters or clear braindead players or boosted noobs ruining game, just because "it is allowed to be bad" is a very stupid thing too.
